div.head: This is to the CLERGY Who are the Men that goes about to ſettle RELIGION (As they ſay) according to the Church of England. Whether they may be BISHOPS or PRESBYTERS, or what Name ſoever they may go under.
div.p:
I Am moved of the Lord God to give you a Warning from him in love to all your ſouls, that you may not bring upon your ſelves the guilt of innocent blood, and that you may be ware and cautious concerning this thing, which is of great and high Concernment, leſt you do intrench upon the Right and Prerogative of CHRIST JESUS, who is the Head of his Church, which is his Body,
Eph. 1.21, 22. the fulneſs of him that filleth all in all, far above all Principalities and Powers, Might and Dominion, & every Name that is named; not only in this World, but alſo in that which is to come, who hath led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men, ſome Apoſtles, ſome Prophets, ſome Evangeliſts, and ſome Paſtors and Teachers, for the perfecting of the Saints, for the work of the Miniſtry, for the edifying of the Body of Chriſt; that was the End and Work that they had to do, who had received gifts from God for the Work of the Miniſtry: Now
if you have this Authority from CHRIST, who is the Head of the Body, his Church, & have received Commiſſion from him, and the gifts which he gives for this Work, then you would be tender over his Saints and Lambs which he hath gathered into his Fold in this his Day, by the Miniſtration of his Spirit which he hath given unto every one to profit with all; and no man by the Spirit of God calleth Jeſus accurſed: Now prove your ſelvs, & let your practice prove you, whether you have your derivation from this Root and Rock on which the whole Church is built, which Rock is CHRIST, who gives diverſities of Gifts by the ſame Spirit; for to one is given by the Spirit, the Word of Wiſdom, to another the word of knowledge by the ſame Spirit, to another Faith by the ſame Spirit, to another the gift of healing by the ſame Spirit, to another the working of Miracles, to another Propheſie, to another diſcerning of Spirit, to another divers kinds of Tongues, and to another the Interpretation of Tongues; but all theſe worketh that one, and the ſelf-ſame ſpirit.

Now if you drink of this Spirit, and be baptized into this body, which you profeſs to ſucceed from, then will you be tender, and be careful of thoſe that have received theſe gifts of his Spirit, which may be ſeveral and various, which Spirit cannot be limited, becauſe it proceeds from the Lord of Heaven and Earth; 1 Cor. 12. and though there may be differences of Adminiſtrations, yet the ſame Lord; and though there may be diverſities of operations, it is the ſame God that worketh all in all: And this is he that cannot be limited, who hath created Heaven and Earth, and rules and orders all things by the Word of his Power, who will make all ſubject unto him and will make all his people willing in this day of his Power, to be obedient unto him, who is coming to rule in the hearts and conſciences of men; and there is he eſtabliſhing his Throne, which is for ever and ever, and his Scepter there he will ſway, which is a righteous Scepter, and the Nations will he rule with a Rod of Iron, & break to pieces all his Enemies like a Potters Veſſel.

Now it is very like that you, or at leaſt many of you cannot believe that he is thus come, and coming; and therefore you may take the more boldneſs and liberty to act againſt him & his Power, becauſe you will not ſee nor believe that this is he; now that you may not be ignorant when Chriſt appears againſt thoſe his Enemies that would not that he ſhould reign,
am I moved to warn you, before you proceed and go on in acting againſt the Lord God, that you may not be ignorant in this thing.

Conſider, Paul (who once was called Saul) how zealous he was in perſecuting of the Saints, and he had great reaſon, in that he was a Jew outward, and touching the Law, a Phariſee, and concerning the Law blameleſs; yet in the blindneſs of his zeal and ignorance, breathed he out threatnings againſt the Saints, which afterwards was his ſorrow. Now ſit down ſolemnly, and conſider ſeriouſly, that God is a Spirit, and his Worſhip is in the Spirit, and he hath promiſed the pouring forth of his Spirit, and this cannot be limited to Time, nor Place, nor Perſon; for it is not men that ye have to deal with in this thing, but the Lord; this is the Stone that all the Builders ever ſet at nought, and did diſallow, which now is become the Head of the Corner, which indeed is the Lord's doing, and its marvelous in our eyes.

Now if a man deſires the Office of a Biſhop, he deſires a good Work, and not a great Name only; but he deſires that the good Work of God may go on, and not to ſtop it: But a Biſhop muſt be blameleſs, the Husband of one Wife, valiant, ſober, and of a good behaviour, apt to teach, not given to wine, no ſtriker, 1 Tim. 3. Tit. 1.6. not greedy of filthy lucre, but patient, not a brawler, nor covetous, one that ruleth well his own Houſe; for if a man know not how to rule his own Houſe, how ſhall he take care of the Church of God: For a Biſhop muſt be blameleſs as the Steward of God, not ſelf-willed, nor ſoon angry, but a lover of good men, ſober, juſt, holy, and temperate. Theſe are the Qualifications and Marks of them that ſhould be Overſeers of the Church of God, And likewiſe Deacons muſt be grave, not double-tongued, not given to much wine, not given to filthy Lucre, holding the Myſtery of Faith in a pure Conſcience: Let theſe alſo, firſt be proved, ſaith the Apoſtle. And ſo thoſe that deſires or looks after, or takes upon them theſe Offices of being Biſhops and Deacons, and to be Overſeers of the Church of God, they ought to be proved and tryed before-hand, whether they are men fearing God, and hating Covetouſneſs, bringing forth fruits of the Spirit, not men of corrupt minds, not reprobate concerning the Faith, but holding the Myſtery of Faith in a pure Conſcience, void of offence, and were to give no offence, neither to the Jew, nor Gentile, nor to the Church of God; Such were
theſe, from whom the men of our Age would ſeem to derive their Pedigree; but if they be ſearched thorowly, they wil appear to be of a later ſtanding, & to be Branches which ſprings from another Root, which indeed is the Pope, from whence they had their Riſe and Beginning, as might be clearly evidenced and demonſtrated, if it be deſired: Now it will be good and ſafe that theſe men do ſtand upon their own Foundation and Ground, and not to ſtretch themſelves beyond their meaſure, nor to limit the Spirit of God, which limits all things, 2 Cor. 10.12. and ſearches all things, even the deep things of God: The Apoſtle ſaid, Them that meaſure themſelves by themſelves, and compared themſelves amongſt themſelves, were not wiſe; and ſaid, They would not boaſt themſelves without their meaſure, but according to the meaſure of the Rule which God had given them; Not boaſting themſelves without their meaſure that is, of other mens labours, but his glorying was in the Lord, and in the Hope he had in him, who commended himſelf to every man's Conſcience in the ſight of God: And ſo now, if you come to be approved and tried by that of God in every mans Conſcience, then ye will not limit nor offend that in the conſcience, if ye be made manifeſt to that of God in every mans conſcience, in the ſight of God, then will you not lay Burdens, Yoaks, and oppreſſions upon them, but fulfil the Royal Law, according to the Scriptures, which ſaith, Thou ſhalt love thy Neighbour as thy ſelf: In this you will do well; but if you reſpect perſons, you wil commit ſin: For the Apoſtle ſaith, God hath choſen the poor of this world, rich in Faith and Heirs of the Kingdom, which he hath promiſed to them that love him; For God hath choſen the fooliſh things of the World to confound the Wiſe; 1 Cor. 27, 28. and God hath choſen the weak things of the World to confound the things which are mighty, and baſe things of the World, and things which are deſpiſed hath God choſen, yea and things that are not, to bring to nought the things that are, that no felſh might glory in his treſence.

So it will be for your peace and ſafety, not to be partial in your ſelves, and ſo become Judges with evil thoughts, and judge that to be evil which you know not to be evil; for they that did ſpeak evil of the things that they knew not, the Apoſtle ſaid,
Iude 10.11 the wo was unto them, for they went in the way of Cain and ran greedily after the error of Balaam: And ſo keep you out
of this Way, leſt the hand of the Lord ſtop you, and you periſh in the gain-ſaying of Core, as they did. And be not Judges of other mens Conſciences, nor take not upon you to uſurp Authority over the Conſciences of men,
Jam. 4.12. for that is Chriſt's Prerogative, and the place of his Throne; For there is one Law-giver, who is able both to ſave, and to deſtroy: So your ſafeſt way will be to leave people to this of God in their conſcience, which they muſt ſtand or fall to, and none to judge another mans Servant, for to his own Maſter muſt he ſtand or fall: But thoſe that will have you to rule over them, and can receive your Doctrine, and own your Church-Government, and Church-fellowſhip, ſuch you may Rule over; for there is a neceſſity that thoſe that are not guided by that of God in their conſciences, there muſt be a Law for ſuch to Rule and Govern them, who are not ſubjected to that of God in them, but are Lawleſs: But truly I ſay unto you, it will be dangerous for you to ſtrive againſt the Power, and the Hand which is now ſtretched forth for the redeeming and recovering the Seed from under Bondage & Captivity, under which they have been long held. Oh remember what it was that daſhed you to pieces before! The ſame Rock is preſent ſtil, and changeth not; It was the Preſſures, and the Burdens, the Yoaks and Bondages that were impoſed upon Peoples conſciences, that was the cauſe that their ſpirits were raiſed and heightened, and therefore were they even reſolved to fight to the death, for the LIBERTY of their CONSCIENCES; this LIBERTY of CONSCIENCE is of great weight, & gives a great ſtroke in the minds of People; this you will find to be true: Look back and conſider what was impoſed formerly in the dayes of the Biſhops, what Spiritual COURTS, and ſpiritual LAWYERS, what Sitations and EXCOMMUNICATIONS, and limiting to Pariſhes, &c. Oh! ſuch grievous Burdens, as were even heavy to be born: Ye have ſuffered for thoſe things, and God did caſt you out, and diſpoſſeſs you of thoſe things, even by reaſon of thoſe ſad and heavy burdens which the people of theſe Nations ſuffered under, which formerly they could not bear: And now you will find it hard to bring them back into that Bondage again; and now you are in a hope of a poſſibility and likelihood of your being tried the ſecond time, but beware that you reſiſt not the Hand that hath ſmitten
you, for it will be in vain for you to kick againſt the pricks; for the Work of the Lord muſt go on which he hath begun in this his Day, in which he is delivering & redeeming his Seed out of Bondage, and bringing back the Captivity of Iſrael, and the diſperſed of Judah; for he hath heard the cry of the oppreſſed Seed, and he hath felt its groanings, and ſeen its ſorrow, and heard its ſighings, and becauſe of the Innocent, he is engaged to plead with all fleſh; for the Deliverer is come to Zion, ſo that Jacob ſhall rejoice, and Iſrael ſhall be glad, and he that is the SUPREME JUDGE in the conſcience is ariſen, who purgeth the Conſcience from dead Works, to ſerve the living God; and the voice is heard which ſaith, Ariſe you dead, and come to judgement; and the time is come, and now is, that the dead do hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that hears, do live; and he that is the Reſurrection and the Life is manifeſted, and he that believes on him, though he be dead, yet ſhall he live; and he that lives and believes, out of his belly flows Rivers of living Waters: And this Fountain and Current is ſet open, which all the Powers of Darkneſs cannot ſtop, which will fill the earth with the knowledge of the Lord, even as the waters the ſea: Therefore let all Hands be ſtaid, and all Mouths ſtopt that would act and ſpeak againſt this;
Pro. 21.30 Iſa. 14. for there is no Wiſdom, nor Underſtanding, nor Councel againſt the Lord: I will ariſe (ſaith the Lord) of Hoſts, and cut off from Babylon the Name and Remnant, Son and Nephew, (ſaith the Lord) and I will make it a Poſſeſſion for the Bittern, and I will ſweep it with the Beſom of Deſtruction, ſaith the Lord of Hoſts, who hath ſworn, ſaying, Surely as I have thought, ſo ſhall it come to paſſe, and as I have purpoſed, ſo ſhall it ſtand. And this is the hand that is ſtretched out upon all Nations; ſo let all fear and tremble before him, who is a conſuming Fire to the Wicked, who is coming to render recompence to his Adverſaries, and Fury to his enemies; for the tranſgreſſions of the people are multiplied, and their Iniquities and ſins teſtifies to their faces; for they go on in tranſgreſſing and lying againſt the Lord, and they are departed from the Way of God, and are ſpeaking and uttering Words of falſhood, & Judgement is turned away backward, and Juſtice ſtandeth afar off; For Truth is fallen in the ſtreets, and Equity cannot enter; yea, Truth falleth, and he that departeth from Iniquity, maketh himſelf a prey, and the Lord
hath ſeen it, and it hath diſpleaſed him that there is no true Judgement; therefore hath he put on Righteouſneſs for a Breſt-plate, and a Helmet of Salvation upon his Head, and he hath put on the Garments of Vengeance for Cloathing, and clad with Zeal as a Cloak; according to their deeds, accordingly will he repay; ſo ſhall they fear the Name of the Lord from the Weſt, and his glory from the riſing of the Sun; and the redeemed ſhall come to Zion, and unto them that turn from tranſgreſſion in Jacob: So every one that feareth the Lord, and worketh righteouſneſs, will be accepted of him, and no evil tydings can come to ſuch; and the Lords people ſhall never be aſhamed, though they may ſuffer much, and undergo many ſad afflictions, yet if their ſuffering be not for evil doing, but for the Lord, and for conſcience-ſake, it will not be worthy to be compared to the glory which ſhall be revealed; but it wil be good for you that are called Miniſters and Teachers, that ye have not your hands in blood and perſecution; for the blood of the Innocent wil cry aloud in the ears of the Lord; and when he looks & beholds that there is no Pleader in the Earth, then is he engaged to ſtand up, and to own that which no eye pitties, which breaths unto him alone, and cannot be ſatisfied without life and refreſhment from him, who is now raiſing up Paſtors after his own heart, which loves him, and feeds his Lambs and his Sheep, over which he is the Shepherd; and therefore they cannot want, but he feeds them with green Paſtures, who is the Biſhop of the ſoul, and thoſe that rules over his flock, watches for the ſouls of people.

Therefore remember that you are warned in your lifetime to keep your hands from limiting of peoples Conſciences, whoſe Appeal is onely unto the Lord, the Souls Biſhop, and ſo cannot be limited by no man: Remember alſo, that there were Paſtors that deſtroyed the Vinyard, and the Heritage was unto the Lord as a ſpeckled Bird; and when they aſſembled, they were as Beaſts of the Field that came to devour, and God's Tabernacle was ſpoyled, and their Paſtors were become brutiſh, they ſought not the Lord, and therefore they did not proſper, but their Flocks were ſcattered.

Conſider of this, and ſee what the Lord is doing, and do not wilfully ſhut your eyes againſt the Hand of the Lord, leſt you fall into utter ruine and deſtruction; for he is the ſame to day, as he was yeſterday and for ever; and as you tender your own ſouls, and your eternal peace and comfort, be tender of tender Conſciences, which the Lord hath made tender, and which are tender and dear unto him; and make not ye their hearts ſad, which the Lord hath not made ſad, which if you do, ſad and heavy will be your miſery; and if you ſhould go about to limit and bind people to your wayes and worſhips, even upon pain of Firing, Priſoning, Baniſhing, yea if it be to Maſſacring and Martyring, you wil find that there is a people in this Nation that will give up their lives and their Blood for their Teſtimony which they hold, which is the teſtimony of Jeſus, the Spirit of Propheſie, and that will follow the Lamb whereſoever he goes; here is the patience of the Saints, they that keep the Commandments of God, and the Faith of Jeſus, who ſhall overcome by the blood of the Lamb, and the Word of their Teſtimony, who loves not their lives unto death; And now remember that you cannot plead ignorance of this, nor that you are not forewarned that ye might avoid ſhedding innocent blood, which will be an everlaſting Teſtimony for the Lord when he comes to make Inquiſition for Blood, and when he comes to plead the cauſe of the Innocent, who have ſuffered innocently, and for CONSCIENCE SAKE, and not for any evil-doing: Then what will you anſwer him? Oh harden not your hearts while it is called to day, but ceaſe to do evil, and learn to do well, that the Lord may have mercy on you, who delights in Mercy, and loves not the death of ſinners, but rather that they ſhould turn from their wickedneſs, and live.
LONDON, Printed for Robert Wilſon, and are to be ſold at his Shop at the ſign of the Black-spread-Eagle and Wind-Mill, in Martins L'Grand, 1660.
